Whitehall 3-5600
April 30, 1952
Mr. Burton Paulu
Manager
KUOM
Universtiy of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burton:
I was delighted to get your note of April 25th,
I, too, regretted my inability to be in Columbus, but from
all reports I gather that everything went along vexy well
without me.
Insofar as Educational Television Programs, Inc.
is concerned. Pro bat. Miles, and I spent long hours at State
College working up the proposal which has been forwarded to
Scottie Fletcher. We had the benefit of counsel from Dick
Hall and McCarty, as well as Parker Wheatley and Hudson. I
am hopeful that a copy of the proposal will be forthcoming
from Protest's office, because I have been very insistent that
you and Graydon, as alternates on the Committee, be kept fully
informed of everything in the way of deliberations and action.
My felicitations on the Lenten Music Festival. You
have succeeded in cracking the music pages which is what I have
been talking about for several years. If some of the other
Brethren would only take a lift from your book, we would really
be going places. More power to your right ana.
I am sending you a digest of Convention Locations
whidh should certainly by amusing if not constructive.
Cordially yours.
Seymour N. Siegel
Director
sns/h
Enc.
